file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 36-11-01-04 - ENGINE BLEED-AIR CHECK VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ENGINE BLEED-AIR CHECK VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the engine bleed-air check valve. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ENGINE BLEED-AIR CHECK VALVE - RE- ALL 36-11-01-000-801-A MOVAL ENGINE BLEED-AIR CHECK VALVE - IN- ALL 36-11-01-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 36-11-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 36-11-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ENGINE BLEED-AIR CHECK VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to remove the engine bleed-air check valve. (2) This task is applicable to the four bleed-air check valves. They are installed two on the LH engine and two on the RH engine. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 71-11-01-000-801-A/400 ENGINE UPPER COWLING - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 412 412 - Upper cowling LH engine 422 422 - Upper cowling RH engine D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Ladder To get access to the work area 2 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH engine and RH engine I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the upper cowling (AMM TASK 71-11-01-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 36-11-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE BLEED-AIR SYSTEM DUCTS OR COMPONENTS IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE ENGINE OR APU STOPS BECAUSE OF THE HIGH BLEED-AIR TEMPERATURE. CAUTION: WHEN YOU REMOVE THE VALVE, BE CAREFUL NOT TO LET ITS GASKETS FALL DOWN INTO THE ENGINE. (1) Release the clamp (3) to disconnect the engine bleed-air check valve from the ducts (1) and (6). (2) Remove the engine bleed-air check valve (4). (3) Remove and discard the gaskets (2) and (5). (4) Install the protective plastic plugs to the ducts (1) and (6). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 36-11-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Engine Bleed-Air Check Valve - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A DET. A ZONES AIR FLOW 415 FROM 425 1. DUCT ENGINE 3. CLAMP 5. GASKET 2. GASKET 6. DUCT 1 AIR FLOW FROM ENGINE 4. BLEED AIR 2 CHECK VALVE RADIAL LINE SLOT GUIDE PIN (REF.) (REF.) C AIR FLOW TO PYLON DET. B RADIAL LINE 90˚ 3 BLEED AIR CHECK VALVE AIR FLOW TO PYLON TUBE 1 TORQUE: 6.8 - 7.3 N.m (60 - 65 lb.in) REFER TO TASK 20-10-10-910-801-A FOR CORRECT INSTALLATION OF V-CIAMPS. 2 THE BLEED AIR CHECK VALVE MUST BE INSTALLED WITH ITS FLAP SHAFT CENTER LINE POSITIONED ON THE ENGINE RADIAL LINE PRE-MOD S.B. 145-36-0011. DET. C 3 THE BLEED AIR CHECK VALVE MUST BE INSTALLED WITH ITS GUIDE PIN POSITIONED ON THE ENGINE RADIAL LINE POS-MOD S. B. 145-36-0011. 145AMM360013.MCE G EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 36-11-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 36-11-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. ENGINE BLEED-AIR CHECK VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the engine bleed-air check valve. (2) This task is applicable to the bleed-air check valves of the LH engine and RH engine. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 20-10-10-910-801-A/200 V-BAND CLAMPS - INSTALLATION ENGINE BLEED AIR CHECK VALVES - OPERATION- AMM TASK 36-11-01-700-801-A/500 AL CHECK AMM TASK 71-11-01-400-801-A/400 ENGINE UPPER COWLING - INSTALLATION IPC 36-11-00 ENGINE BLEED AIR SYSTEM C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 412 412 - Upper cowling LH engine 422 422 - Upper cowling RH engine D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the clamp available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Ladder To get access to the work area 2 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Gasket IPC 36-11-00 2 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 36-11-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH engine and RH engine I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT THE LINE TUBES ARE CLEAN, WITHOUT DUST, SOLIDS, GREASE, ETC. (1) Remove the plastic plugs from the ducts (1) and (6). (2) Install the new gaskets (2) and (5). CAUTION: • THE BLEED AIR CHECK VALVE MUST BE INSTALLED WITH ITS FLAP SHAFT CENTER LINE ON THE ENGINE RADIAL LINE PRE-MOD. S.B. 145-36-0011. • THE BLEED AIR CHECK VALVE MUST BE INSTALLED WITH ITS GUIDE PIN ON THE ENGINE RADIAL LINE POST-MOD. S.B. 145-36-0011. (3) Install the engine bleed-air check valve (4) with the arrow in the bleed-air flow direction. NOTE: The direction of the air flow is from the engine to the pylon. (4) Connect the engine bleed-air check valve to the ducts (1) and (6). CAUTION:REFER TO AMM TASK 20-10-10-910-801-A/200 FOR CORRECT INSTALLATION OF MARMAN V-CLAMP. (5) Install the clamp (3). (6) Tighten the clamp (3) to the torque shown in (Figure 401). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the upper cowling (AMM TASK 71-11-01-400-801-A/400). (2) Do an operational check of the Engine Bleed-Air Check Valve ( AMM TASK 36-11-01-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 36-11-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
